snp4.14:4.3: Reading _puṭṭho_ per variants, and contra most translators and the Niddesa. I find the renderings by Bodhi, Norman, and Ñāṇadīpa to be borderline incomprehensible. The passage up till now has been about conceit that arises from knowledge. I think the sense here is the same as an9.14:11.11: _Sādhu kho tvaṁ, samiddhi, puṭṭho puṭṭho vissajjesi, tena ca mā maññī_.
